intro: Raphionacme abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian raphionacme, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native region. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
